data.title: good sandwich
data.text: We had a good sandwich but the service was not great.  The server was nice but was not very experienced.  There was a lady at the counter near the baked goods who did not say hello and I also waited quite a while for her to get off of the phone to get out dessert.  Handy location if you are downtown but nothing special.

data.title: Named right, Delectable Edibles
data.text: Delicious lunch menu, especially the chicken salad plate.  Too many "desserts" to choose from - multiple trips will help you make up your mind as to your favorites!

data.title: Solid food and so-so sweets
data.text:
I've eaten at Delectable Edibles multiple times when I lived in Dothan. Some of my experiences were not the best, but overall they are a solid lunch and small treat option.

The service was always just okay. Some of the servers were friendly, some not friendly at all. It seemed like they were perpetually short-staffed. 

Their lunch options never disappointed. I've had an enjoyed most of their menu items, especially the chicken salad and spinach wrap with chicken. Their loaded baked potato soup is delicious.

I learned quickly which of their sweets to stay away from, and which to consistently order. Their truffles aren't a real truffle, more of a cake ball, but usually tasty. The brownies and blondies were a solid option. Unfortunately, I had two slices of cake in a row that were dry and lacked flavor, so I didn't make a habit of ordering them.

All in all, it's a solid option for lunch, especially if you work in the area, and for some small treats for yourself or the family.

data.title: Chicken Salad and a slice of pound cake- you can't go wrong!
data.text: Their chicken salad plate with fruit is delicious!! While there, you must try a piece of their homemade pound cake with cream cheese icing. Everyone is friendly and and the food is great :)

data.title: Great food, great service and great price!
data.text: Delectable Edibles is right down from our office building, so we get to go quite often. In the several times I have been, I have never been disappointed in anything there, whether it is the people, food or price. Stop by!

data.title: unsatified customer
data.text: food was cold and on paper plates (cheap paper plates).  Hostess was not real friendly.  Atmosphere was not welcoming.

owner_response.author: Roni M, Owner at Delectable Edibles and More, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am sorry that you were unsatisfied at your recent visit to Delectable Edibles. I'm kind of at a loss because we stopped using paper plates back in May and either have ceramic plates & bowls for certain items on our menu & use baskets with deli paper for sandwiches. I'd like to know more about what you got & that may help me understand what it was served on.  If you were unhappy with anything, I wish you would have told someone while you were there so we could at least try to rectify the situation. Feedback (good or bad) can be very helpful to let us know we need to change something or that we are getting something right. I would love to talk with you further if you are willing to help make us better. We can't fix what we don't know needs to be different. My personal goal is to create a pleasurable dining experience with good food & service. I'm sorry we didn't provide that for you. I hope you will give us another chance to try to meet that goal.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hidden Gem Downtown Dothan
data.text: Our first visit was very favorable. This restaurant is in the middle of downtown on Foster Street. It has a relaxing, casual atmosphere with sufficient seating. The food offerings are deli type sandwiches, salads creapes, quiche, etc., and delicious desserts, also various take home casseroles. I ordered the chicken broccoli creape,which was delicious, with a side of fresh fruit, husband ordered BLT on homemade bread, he said was very good.  The staff was friendly and the service was excellent. We enjoyed our lunch and will return.

data.title: Hidden Jem Downtown
data.text:
Delectable Edibles Café is a very quaint little café that everyone needs to try.  

I first stumbled upon this café during a Foster Fest evening when I was on the hunt for a Latte for my wife.  Not too many American places can make my wife’s eyebrows raise when enjoying a plain Latte, but Delectable Edibles Café did!  If you are looking for a European quality coffee, this is it.

So a month later, while at another Foster Fest, I stopped in for a light meal with my wife and son.  I got the chicken salad on a crescent, my son got a cup of soup, and we indulged with a few homemade sweets.  Honestly, my wife fell in love immediately.  The food is fantastic, and tastes very fresh.  The atmosphere is refreshing and very…mix between old school American café and European feel.  The place is very warm and inviting.  When visiting, you can sit and enjoy the company you are with for an hour or two over great food, treats and coffee.  

So, a day or two later, my wife had lunch with a friend at Delectable Edibles Café to try their noon fair.  They both loved it.  The family atmosphere is very relaxing and inviting.  There is no rushing, loud music, televisions blaring, or pressure to turn your table.  Relax, chill and enjoy your time seems to be the unwritten theme to customers.

So, if you have a desire for fresh made food, sweet treats, or the best Latte in town, you need to check this place out.  Don’t forget to drop your business card in the jug for something free!

data.title: Delicious entrees hidden behind a bake shop store front!
data.text: Delectible Edibles recently relocated to S. Foster St in Dothan and I have dined with them prior to moving and twice since. The new location does wonders for the ambiance and lunch experience. I ordered some sweet treats for Easter and ate while there and then went back the next day after receiving coupon. Had the Chicken salad on whole grain croissant. Next day split gourmet grilled cheese on Sun Dried Tomato bread (baked in house) and Club wrap with my husband. All entrees were fabulous! Chicken salad was excellent, the wrap was hearty and tasty, but the grilled cheese was the best! It was so good I'm going back for it again! I had small trays made for my family for Easter with a cupcake, chocolate covered nutter butter, chocolate covered oreo, peanut butter ball and oreo ball for each family member. They turned out so cute we almost didn't want to eat them (but we did and although the chocolate cupcake was a little dry) we did eat all the treats and they were just as tasty. Will be going back for more entrees and sweets from this quaint little back shop and eatery located in downtown Dothan.
